@Makerath This may be 4 years too late but let me tell you, you've got peas for a brain. This is rape ー plain and simple. You're yappin' that there's little to no hesitation on her part?! She's a little kid! Also, she DID quit the next day. It's not rocket science.

@Makerath Does the author need to hold your hand and spell it all out for you in bold capital letters? Read the first page the girls are swimming, it says swimming school. The last three pages one of the girls quit school and there's a new girl on board. 

Also she's frowning starting from page 6, she has no other real expression than a frown. Also her words are basically ah no, no.

@Makerath It definitely looks like rape tho. Whether it really is or not, it's still the same effect. If you rape a girl and tell yourself it isn't tEcHNicaLly rape just to cope, then that just goes for yourself. Doing fucked up shit like this is wrong on many levels, who the hell cares about the correct terminology at such point?
I award this Manga one singular Yike.

I love the magas that leave you with a bitter aftertaste at the end, actually portraying a beautiful image of a corrupted story. The expressions are amazing and the girl is erotic, innocent and cute. Just love this author.

Horrible junk

+sneikkimies And what do you mean he's doing nothing to help the fact? He's kissing her forehead, apologizing for hurting her, saying he loves and that she's cute.
Talk about a bogus argument.

+sneikkimies She quit swimming school, where does it say that? I mean, it's not expressly confirmed, but I suppose more than likely that's true, though the reason is not expressed at all. 
Throughout the entire scene, she does very little in way of resistance. The slight 'no' here and there is commonplace even amongst consensual sex in doujins, and the fact that she's uncomfortable is also commonplace and justifiable given she's a virgin. 
They kiss, they continue, and she doesn't really ever even try to put a stop to it. Now, could mean she's meek, but... how far do we take that exactly? Can I rope you into a contractual agreement that entitles you to give me residence of your home, custody of your children etc. etc. because you're meek? Nobody would take you seriously. 

Come on, the argument is stupid and you're all being emotional. She let the shit happen because she wanted it, and then maybe she felt ashamed, I don't know, and you don't neither.

It's pretty obvious it's rape though, she quits the swimming school the next day. Also, from the way they're having sex, you can see clearly that she's feeling pretty uncomfortable, and he's doing nothing to help the fact, instead just using her for pleasure.

+fallenFromMeaning Okay, firstly, you're going into all kinds of situational nonsense (most of which are assumptions and theories) to try and frame the situation in a light that it's rape, and that's just silly. By the sheer fact that she's underage, this is technically rape. 

But that's not what it rape means in the context of tagging shit, it means forced, that's what people assume when they click on this stuff. So, the tag is not justified, and in future, don't be so pretentious because anyone whom isn't fooled by your pseudo-intellectualism will probably think you a jackass.
oh, and i just realized, the "special" ice probably contained a drug promoting sleep and decreasing later resistance, seems like this is this guy's routine.

while it does not seem really forced it does not seem very consensual either, especially when dealing with someone that young one really should consider their inability to properly express distress and instead regularily confirm positive response without asking in a leading way, as well as being god damn sensitive and cautious. the utter lack of response makes this a quite bit sickening.

It does if you go to Uni. Haven't you been paying attention? If a man and a woman are both drunk and have intercourse and the woman decides she regrets it than the man is held accountable as being a rapist because "it's the current year".

same...
and does it really count as rape, when she is sweet-talked into it?
